intro: Auriculardisia cartagoana, commonly known as the Cartagena earplant, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, tropical environments. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
